PORTLAND AT YOUR FEET

A programme that is truely designed to make your stay in Jamaica memorable. Simply sign up today or book a trip to get started.

THE VIBES

To mark a new day in luxury rustic accommodation, Sinopia Inn has created the exclusive Portland Jamaica Experience. What makes us truly exclusive are our services and our amazing range of experiences – authentic adventures that explore behind the scenes and beneath the surface to discover Jamaica’s hidden gems. PORTLAND AT YOUR FEET is specially tailored to immerse you in Portland’s surroundings and make your time with us unforgettable.  Check out what’s included below and don’t forget to Sign up today and start receiving discounted rates and special offers

PORTLAND'S TOURIST HISTORY

Portland Jamaica, as a destination, won’t disappoint. In the 1940s and 50s, the parish of Portland, and in particular the town of Port Antonio, was the setting of numerous Hollywood films and a favourite destination for many Hollywood stars including Clara Bow, Ginger Rogers and Errol Flynn. Errol Flynn called Port Antonio heaven on earth and once owned nearby Navy Island, after winning it in a game of dominoes. It is said that he was so in love with the area he claimed he never met a woman as beautiful as Port Antonio.

PORTLAND'S FILM HISTORY

This small rural port, with its beautiful harbour, is certainly a creative place. Robin Moore, the author of The French Connection, is said to have written the famous novel while sitting under a mango tree in Port Antonio. More than 782 film or screen productions have been shot in Portland. Two of the most popular are Twenty Thousand Leagues Under The Sea, by Walt Disney (USA) in 1954 and The Harder They Come by Vista Productions (Jamaica) in 1972. Scenes from the film Cocktail starring Tom Cruise were shot at the bar on the beach at the Dragon Bay resort. An early film edition of the 1963 version of The Lord Of The Flies was largely shot at Frenchman's Cove; Club Paradise starring Robin Williams featuring Reggae artist Jimmy Cliff; the 1990 remake by Harry Hook was filmed largely at Frenchman's Cove and Snow Hill. Rihanna filmed the video for her song "Man Down" in various locations throughout the parish in April/May 2011. Even celebrity pop singer Beyonce has been spotted rafting at the world famous Blue Lagoon.

WHAT'S INCLUDED

Up until the end of their stay, guests are treated to an traditional Jamaican breakfast and will have the opportunity to take a guided tour to any local amenity. In addition, guests receive a Jamaican inspired hamper,  inclusive of our signature home made seasonings, authentic Jamaican rum, coffee, assorted jellies and confectioneries, juices, local oils and shower gels to complete their experience. Got a question? Ask us! info@sinopiainn.com
